alert.note: Alert for Harnett; Johnston; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 5:46PM EDT until September 10 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Harnett, Johnston and Wake. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 546 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Cary, Smithfield, Wake Forest, Garner, Fuquay- Varina, Clayton, Zebulon, Benson, RDU International, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, Knightdale, Wendell, Erwin, Rolesville, Coats, Lake Benson and Lake Wheeler. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
